name: LASER 200 / 210
keyboard: QWERTY, 45 rubber keysBasic instructions and graphic symbols
ram: 2 KB (Laser 200) / 6 KB (Laser 210/ VZ 200 / Salora Fellow)Up to 64 KB with memory addons
ports: Tape-recorder (600 bauds)RF video outComposite video out (DIN)Memory upgrade portExpansion port
description:
The Laser 200 / 210 was sold worldwide under different brands (Dick Smith, Texet, Salora, etc...). Maybe the most popular of these "foreign models" was the VZ-200 sold by Dick Smith Electronics.

The Laser 200 is the successor of the poor Laser 110 and was followed by the Laser 310.

It was a good choice if you wanted to buy a cheap computer for initiation.

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> DICK SMITH VZ-200</strong></font><br><blockquote>Same case as the Laser 200, but with more memory (8k).<p class="petitgris"><a href="http://www.homecomputer.de">Thanks to S. Walgenbach for the picture</a></p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> THE LASER 210</strong></font><br><blockquote>Same case as the Salora Fellow, different from the Laser 200.<p class="petitgris"><a href="http://www.homecomputer.de">Thanks to S. Walgenbach for the picture</a></p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> THE SALORA FELLOW</strong></font><br><blockquote>Different case from the Laser 200, but the same one as the Laser 210.<p class="petitgris"><a href="http://www.homecomputer.de">Thanks to S. Walgenbach for the picture</a></p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> REAR OF THE LASER 200</strong></font><br><blockquote>From left to right: <br><br> Power supply | Tape-recorder | Monitor | Memory expansion port | Peripheral port | Video output</blockquote>

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT (JULY 84)</strong></font><br><blockquote>''The Laser 200, a Secam color micro-computer really very suprising''</blockquote>

hardwareDescription:
The following extensions were available:

- 4 colours printer
- 16k RAM
- 64k RAM
- Light Pen
- Joystick
- DR10 Tape recorder
- DR30 Tape recorder
- DD20 5"1/4 disk drive

emulator.name: VZEM
emulator.description: The emulator is written in Borland C++. It emulates a VZ200/300 with 34k RAM

emulator.name: Emulator2001
emulator.description: The VZ-200 has been added to this multi-emulator
